direction.raw_text: Establishing a perimeter. Making it safe. These guys are really good. One of them was a Green...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kirby, trust me, on this island, there is no such thing as safe. We have to get back in this plane... Grant looks to Amanda, who shouts through a bull horn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And tell your wife to stop making so much noise! We're food to these damn animals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amanda, Honey! Dr. Grant says it's a bad idea!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says it's a bad idea!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's a bad idea? As in on cue, there is a DEAFENING ROAR from the jungle. Everyone turns toward the sound and freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? Grant doesn't answer, still listening to the reverberations. Then a couple shots are heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it a rex?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. Billy and Paul breathe a small sign of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds bigger. Nash and Udesky come RUNNING out of the jungle, headed for the plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta go, now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem? Can't you guys...? As Udesky and Nash sprint past Paul in interrupted by a second, closer, DEAFENING ROAR. He pales. 29
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Udesky waits by the door, hustling everyone inside. Nash hurries into the cockpit. Everyone scrambles to a seat. Amanda climbs next to Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't just...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, honey. We'll circle around and come back. Udesky closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the other guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coop's a professional. He can handle himself. A blood-curdling SCREAM echoes through the jungle followed by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going! Udesky climbs into the copilot's seat, and Nash revs the engine. 30
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane starts down the runway. 31
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The passengers bounce in their seats as the plane picks up speed down the overgrown strip. 32
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, two hundred yards ahead of the plane,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emerges from the jungle. He stands in the middle of the runway. waving one arm wildly. His second, badly injured arm hangs limp by his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Nash. Slow down, buddy. 33
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nash spots Cooper, shoots a glance at the airspeed indicator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coop, you know I can't do it pal. He slams down full throttle in an attempt to reach flying speed. Seeing that Nash has no intention of stopping, Paul shouts from the cabin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? That's Mr. Cooper! 34
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are looking down on Cooper from behind. As the plane approaches,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: falls over the injured mercenary. Then with brutal speed, an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: seizes him in its massive jaws and lifts him into the air. From this angle we get only a glimpse of a long crocodilian snout, powerful clawed forearms and spiny sail rising from the creature's back. 35
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All eyes are on the creature as it devours Cooper. Amanda turns away in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God! Paul, my God! 36
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking through the windshield, we see the creature is directly in the path of the plane. Nash pulls back on the stick. The plane rises. The left propeller clips the flank of the enormous dinosaur, SNAPPING the blade. Blood sprays the windshield and side windows. 37
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The turboprop banks into the jungle, out of control. 38
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The passengers are thrown about as the craft CRASHES through trees, tearing off a wing and pieces of the tail. Finally coming to rest in the jungle canopy, the plane settles in the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The passengers slowly recover and have a look around. Foliage blocks most windows, making it impossible to see out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is anyone hurt? Checking themselves, everyone seems pretty much intact. Still thinking of himself as in charge...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet! We're okay. Let's everybody just stay put. He attempts to turn on the cockpit radio, but it's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's got the sat-phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here! Paul hands the bulky phone up to Nash, who dials out. Grant unstraps himself, climbs to the back to the side door and shoves. The door opens a few inches before hitting a branch. He looks out the and lets out a quiet gasp as the ground reels
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He quickly shuts and latches the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the sat-phone. pressed against Nash's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're sorry. All circuits are busy. Please try your call again later...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? What's the matter? Amanda SCREAMS. A huge reptilian face appears in the cockpit window. Everyone else SCREAMS now. The plane LURCHES - and we hear a deep GROWL. The passengers hold tight, paralyzed. Nash buckles himself into his seat. Suddenly, the plane is YANKED from the side to side. Battered this way and that, the terrified passengers tightly grip their seats. Finally, the horrible sounds of WRENCHING METAL as the nose of the plane is RIPPED RIGHT OFF. Nash and Udesky are suddenly sitting in open air. The nose of the plane is tilting downwards, the jungle floor far below. The passengers hang almost vertically in their seats, Debris tumbles out the open end of the plane, some of it striking Nash in the head. Udesky unbuckles his seat belt and climbs back up into the cabin. Nash follows. Suddenly, a long snout with dagger-like teeth pushes past the cockpit seats, opens wide, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Nash's legs. The pilot CRIES OUT in agony. The others passengers grab onto his arms, trying to pull him back. But it's no use. The dinosaur rips Nash out of their grasp and down the aisle. Nash desperately grabs on to the seat cushion, then watches in horror as the fabric RIPS AWAY. He's pulled out of the plane and dropped to the ground. A giant foot steps in the way as the snout of the creature reaches down and quickly devourers the screaming pilot. It's horrifying sight, but no one can turn away. Pleased with the appetizer, the creature comes back for the main course. Grant tries to force open the jammed rear door. Billy tries to help, but the door won't budge. The dinosaur JAMS its snout into the fuselage and lunges for Amanda in the first row. She yanks her legs back as the jaws
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Behind Amanda, Billy reaches forward, UNSNAPS her seat belt and pulls her into the next row back. The others unstrap their belts and crowd into the rear of the passenger compartment. The shift in weight sends the fuselage tipping backwards. 39
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane breaks free of the tree limbs and DROPS tail-first to the jungle floor. It SLAMS hard, then flips over onto its roof. 40
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The passengers are prowled on the ceiling of the plane, dazed by the impact. Everyone is cut and bruised. Out of the open cockpit, they see two approaching dino feet. A window near Amanda fogs over with condensation. when it clears, she finds herself looking right into enormous eyes. Then all hell breaks loose as the plane is SLAMMED across the jungle clearing. The passengers are hammered against the walls of the plane, tumbling like socks in a dryer. Debris, seats and luggage fly everywhere. 41
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane comes to an abrupt halt as it SMASHES into a tree. A gargantuan FOOT steps on the fuselage and FLATTENS it like a paper tube. 42
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside, windows EXPLODE, raining glass over the passengers. As the walls compress, Udesky becomes trapped in the rear of the plane, the others in front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over here! Udesky dives into the narrowing gap, and Billy pulls him the rest of the way through. Billy is as terrified as the rest of them, but he thrives under this rush of adrenaline. Then a huge CLAW digs into the skin of the fuselage and begins to slowly PEEL the plane open. Grant looks up in dread at the widening tear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way! Grant leads the group out the open end of the cockpit. They make a mad dash for the jungle. A tremendous ROAR causes Billy to look behind him. He can't help but steal a glimpse of this terrifying, but utterly fascinating, animal. Grant yanks him forward. 43
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With Grant in the lead, and Udesky taking up the rear, the group tears through the jungle. Concealed by the dense undergrowth, the unseen dinosaur bears down on them -- mowing down the young trees which TOPPLE all around them. Grant spots a grove of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and leads the group into it. The dinosaur cannot fit between the trunks. It ROARS at the fleeing humans, searching desperately for a route after them. The group continues their relentless pace, putting as much distance as they can between themselves and the beast. Paul Kirby looks like he's about to have a heart attack. Even Billy is gasping for air. They stop, thinking they've outrun it. Grant directs the group through some underbrush and into -- 44        EXT. CLEARING - CONTINUOUS - DAY                                44 Our friends stop dead in their tracks. Amanda stifles a cry. Before them lies an immense unmoving SAUROPOD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. It's dead. Then a full-grown bull
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises up behind the carcass. It was feeding, its mouth mottled with blood and carrion. Grant FREEZES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody move a muscle. Remember: the T-Rex tracks motion. Obeying, the group FREEZES for a few long beats. Then Udesky takes off running. And T-Rex ROARS. Everyone runs. T-Rex is right behind them. 45
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dashing back the way they came, the group suddenly comes face to face with -- THE FIRST MONSTER. We now get our first full unobstructed view of the gigantic creature, SPINOSAURUS AEGYPTICUS. Over forty feet long and twenty-five feet high, the dinosaur has a bony sail along its back. Its head is crocodilian with rows of long, curving teeth. Sinewy six foot arms terminate in three fingers hands with fourteen inch claws. Nowhere else to run, the group scatters into the brush as the two behemoth predators rush forward, their ROARS thunderous. Paul and Amanda scramble into one direction, Billy and Udesky in the other. But Grant can't go anywhere - his foot is stuck between two branches. He manages to free himself as the two dinosaurs approach. They'll have to deal with each other before eating the humans. Grant dives down between two fallen trees as the Spinosaurus and T- Rex circle one another like gladiators, each searching for the other's weakness. Laying flat on his back, Grant lets out a terrified GASP as the giant foot of Spinosaurus lands across the two trunks mere inches from his face. Spinosaurus lunges forward, powerful jaw open wide. T-Rex sidesteps the assault, its tail knocking down small trees as it spins out of the way. In the tress, Paul and Amanda scurry again for cover. Between the fallen trunks, Grant attempts to get away on his hands and knees. T-Rex presses the attack, slamming its tail into the flank of its adversary. Spinosaurus is knocked back, and Grant is again forced to duck for cover. As Spinosaurus struggles to regain its balance, T-Rex dives forward. Spinosaurus is driven backwards as T-Rex tries to grip its throat. Amanda yanks Paul out of their path. They Scramble over to Billy. Now on its side, Spinosaurus fights back ferociously. It slashes at T-Rex with its long arms and razor sharp claws, then finally kicks the animal with one mammoth foot. Tyrannosaurus staggers back, wounded. Down below, Grant is splashed by the blood pouring from the dinosaur, as he slowly makes his way towards his fellow humans. Spinosaurus lunges for the T-rex with gaping jaws and manages to topple T-Rex off its feet and sends the falling dinosaur to the ground. With an earth-shuttering CRASH, the dinosaur lands between Grant and the rest of the group. The companions scurry out of the way, but as they do so, the head of the T-Rex now lands almost directly on top of them. Plastered against an immense tree, the group watches in horror as T-Rex starts to rise but is thrown back down as Spinosaurus latches onto its throat. Spinosaurus crushes the life out of its adversary, and T-Rex opens and closes its jaw a mere inches from our terrified friends. Finally, Grant reaches the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! Spinosaurus lets out a victorious HOWL, and the blood-drenched professor leads the group through the undergrowth. 46
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winded from running, Paul is caught off-guard as a furious Grant slams his back against a tree. Only one thing he wants to know -- GRANT Why did you bring us here? Paul is too startled to speak. Udesky tires to step in, but Grant gives him back a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our son is on this island. We need your help to find him. Still crunched against the tree, Paul pulls out a photo from his shirt pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is him. Eric. Hes thirteen now. He's just about the greatest kid in the world. Letting go of Paul, Grant takes the photo, a Sears-style portrait of the boy we saw Parasailing at the beginning. He shakes his head, disbelieving. He hands the photo to Billy. The group splits into two sides -- Paul and Amanda, Grant and Billy -- with Udesky stuck between. Dialogue overlaps in places.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's with a man named Ben Hildebrand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her new boyfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A friend. We were vacationing. Eric wanted to see the island and the dinosaurs, so Ben found a guy who would take them parasailing. They never came back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We called everyone, did everything we could. Because of all the controversy over this island, no one will step in. Costa Rica says it's a no-fly zone, it's their own damn fault. Guys at the U.S Embassy -- our U.S. Embassy -- said we should "accept the inevitable." You believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you hired these mercenaries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We prefer "recovery specialists." We do overseas custody issues and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you duped us into coming here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We needed somebody who knew the lay of the land. Somebody who'd been to this island before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have never been on this island!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you have. You wrote that book...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was Isla Nublar. This is Isla Sorna. The second island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know, there were two islands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still, you have survived the dinosaurs before. You saved those kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few of us survived. A lot more died. And we were better prepared and better armed. (finally) How many days have they been missing? A look between Amanda and Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight weeks. Grand and Billy are speechless. It might as well be eight years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After what you've seen today, you really think your son could be alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's smart, Dr. Grant. And he knows so much about dinosaurs. Before anyone else can talk, Grant puts his hand out. He wants everyone to shut up while he plans their next move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm sorry, but no. We'll savage what we can from the plane. Then we head for the coast. There may be a boat left, something to get us off this island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Grant, we're not leaving without our son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can stick with us, or you can go and look for him. Either way you're probably not getting out of here alive. With that he leaves, A beat later, Billy follows. He has genuine sympathy for the Kirby's, but he's logical enough to know Grant is right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look to Udesky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do? Udesky is clearly at a loss, but for everyone's reassurance he tries to mutter some brio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I think we should start searching for your son. In the direction they're going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. They follow after Grant and Billy. 47
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The five survivors search through the wreckage, trying to find anything useful. The task is grim. Mindful of Grant's warnings, they move quickly and quietly. Udesky picks up a gun out of the swampy water. The barrel is bent almost 90 degrees, unless. Billy finds his camera, intact. Digging a change of clothes out of his suitcase, Paul steps around the side of the plane to change. He's in his underwear before he notices Amanda is also there changing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing you haven't seen before. A beat. Amanda looks over as they get dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much weight have you lost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty, twenty-fire pounds. I've been swimming at the Y.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hate to swim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People change. A nod to mean, that's the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do you. They make brief eye contact, which Amanda breaks. Around the side, Billy is taking photos of a giant footprint the dinosaur left in the mud during its attack on the plane. Grant looks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you classify it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously a superpredator. (best guess) Suchimimus. that snout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They never got that big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baryonyx?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not with that sail. (Billy gives up) Spinosaurus Aegypticus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't remember that on InGen's list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because it wasn't on their list. Who knows what else they were up to? Billy looks past Grant to see Paul approaching. He's struggling with the straps on his backpack. turning in circles. Billy regards him with suspicion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Mr. Kirby, tell me, when you climbed K2, did you base camp at 25- or 30,000 feet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty-thousand, I think. Closer to the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About a thousand feet above it, actually. (closer) Most mountain-climbers remember how tall that mountains were. Paul knows he's caught.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no Kirby Enterprises, is there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is. I own a place called Kirby Paint and Title Plus. We're out in the Westgate Shopping Center in Enid, Oklahoma. The "plus" is for bathroom fixtures, fireplaces accessories, patio furniture. Stuff like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't suppose that check you wrote us is any good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He paid us half up front. Cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mortgaged everything we had to do it. Even the store. and if we make it off this island with my son, I swear, I'll make good on the money I owe you. I don't care if it takes me the rest of my life. Grant and Udesky exchange a dubious glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: However long that is. 48
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amanda, Paul, Billy, Udesky and Grant walk through the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop that. Dr. Grant says this is dangerous territory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well we should split up or something. We can cover twice the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Dr. Grant says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Grant says this, Dr. Grant says that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what's the use of hiring an expert if your not going to listen to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because "Dr. Grant" isn't looking for Eric. Dr. Grant is looking for the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine...and when the Tricyclatops comes after you, don't come crying to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't worry about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just drop it Paul! The Kirby's conversation trails off into the jungle. Udesky moves up next to Grant and Billy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If they split up, I'm going with you. And as they continue forward, Billy spots something in the trees ahead. 49
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A parasail chute is caught in the branches of a tree. A yellow life vest hangs limply from a branch. Paul rushes over, unsnags it, and examines the label.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young adult.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Got something here. All turn to see Udesky holding up a camcorder encased in a waterproof shell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Ben's! She grabs it from Udesky and pops open the housing. She tries the power switch on the camcorder, but the battery's dead. Udesky pull out a flashlight from his pack and looks to Amanda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, give that to me. And as Udesky fiddles with the flashlight, Grant and Billy consider the parasail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks intact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should take it with us to signal any planes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've got it. Udesky has rigged the wires on the flashlight so that the batteries can be used to power the camcorder. He brings a live wire to back of the camcorder. A red power light comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It works!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know for how long. Udesky swings the tiny screen out and pushes play. The others crowd around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric and Ben play frisbee on the beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's him. Thats Eric!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I filmed this the morning they left. Ben catches the frisbee, checks his watch and motions to Eric. Eric runs over, and Ben puts his arm around him as they run to the camera. Paul reacts to this image but holds his tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - The image now CUTS to a shot from aboard Enrique's boat speeding towards ISLA SORNA -- the start of the movie. Eric points excitedly at the island and smiles at the camera. We replay the opening moments of the movie from Ben and Eric's perspective, soaring high until...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unclip the line!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from face to face of all watching this tape with a mixture of hope and nausea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Angle again with Ben's legs in the foreground. Falling fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hand on! Hang on buddy! Now the camera penetrates the jungle canopy and the picture and sound become complete chaos: SCREAMS from the both, branches BREAKING, flashes of Ben and Eric's frightened faces as the camera is buffeted in all directions. With a lurch the terrifying descent in finally over, and the jungle floor is just ten feet away, swaying back and forth beneath Ben and Eric's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ok, buddy? There's GURGLING to his voice. Ben may be more hurt than he's letting on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're okay. It's going to be okay. Here, get ready. I'm going to unhook you. The sound of PUMPLING is followed by the sight of Eric DROPPING into the frame, landing on the ground rolling. He stands and looks back up at Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm all right
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to get out of this, pal. And on that, the power and picture fade away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - overjoyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? He's okay. He's alive! Everything's going to be all right now. Amanda brings a hand to her mouth, silently nodding her head. Grant and Billy exchange a dubious look, than begin pulling the parasail out of the tree. As they do so, the sail gets caught on a branch. They pull harder. The branch bends, but the sail won't come loose. One last tug and than, SNAP. The branch breaks, the chute falls away to reveal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It swings down directly at Amanda. She SCREAMS. Finally, the others are able to pull her away. As they untangle the lines, the men are able to get the first view of the remains of Ben Hillenbrand, still caught in his harness. Amanda's knees buckle. Regaining her balance, she runs off into the jungle. Paul quickly follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amanda! 50
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reeling, Amanda comes to a stop in an area with thick undergrowth. It's danger here, very still and quiet. She tries to calm herself, but each effort to suppress just makes her more emotional. She's surprised as Paul wraps an arm around her to comfort her. But she doesn't fight it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry Amanda. I am. And I'm sorry for the things I said about him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you liked Ben. I had no right to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its not about him. It's Eric. He's alone out here somewhere. Our baby is all alone. Saying it aloud, the reality sinks in for both of them
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I was hoping that with Ben around, there'd be someone to keep him safe. Checking in on clients, Udesky stops at the edge of the thicket. Something raises the hairs on the back of his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Grant! He nods for the others to take a look at this. They head over, Grant at the rear. As he approaches, Billy is packing up the rest of the chute in a backpack. He stops short from what he sees. Looking down, we CIRCLE across the jungle floor. Here we find a strange, hollowed-out construction made of sod and branches. Maybe six feet around. Just now noticing the others' stare, Paul looks down into one of the bowls at his feet, a half-buried nest. It's filled with football-sized eggs, laid in a spiral. And this isn't the only nest. Amanda counts twelve in all, laid out in an oddly symmetrical pattern. The last to arrive, Grant identifies the species in a horrified instant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raptors. And as he says the words, off in the distance, we hear the cry of some herbivores, around by the chorus of snarls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The party blasts through the forest, trying to keep up with Grant. They haven't even had time to ask -- AMANDA (to Paul) Whats a raptor? Paul has no idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't look that big. I mean, comparatively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we came across one, we might live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that's good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you never came across just one. From the back -- AMANDA Wait! Where's Billy? They all stop. The only one not there is -- Grant Billy! Billy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we weren't suppose to yell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here! He comes in from the left. Excited, he explains to Grant -- BILLY (CONT'D) I got some great pictures of the nest. You know this proves raptors raised their young in colonies. Furious with his student. Grant just keeps moving. There's no time to stand around and argue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This speaks to a larger social structure, the possibility of Darwinian altruism. It changes everything. A beat. Trying not to sound presumptuous -- BILLY (CONT'D) We could co-write a paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah yes, the first rule of academics. Publish or perish. 52
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIDGE - DAY (HOURS LATER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much fatigued, the five now mach upward towards a crest. Panting and flushed, they reach the top of the ridge and gaze into the distance. A jungle valley stretches before them. Not far off in A VAST COMPOUND - comprised of several buildings. One building alone seems to cover several acres. The weary group breathes a sigh of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet there's a very good chance Eric's in there. I'd bet my bottom dollar. Udesky and Grant share dubious looks and continue down into the valley. 54
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group emerges from the jungles and enters the compound. They walk through an overgrown parking lot, littered with abandoned vehicles. Some are lying on their side. Others are overturned completely. They're not going to be driving anywhere. A troubled Grant peers through a windshield, partially caved in, like some giant head butted the glass. (Think back to Lost World) And the group finally approaches the front doors of an enormous building. As they head up the front steps, we see something in the distance behind them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the high ridge. To fast to see what it was. But too ominous to dismiss. 55
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our friends now find themselves in a sparse, one quietly opulent corporate lobby now in the process of being reclaimed by the jungle/ Roots and ivy poke through the floor and walls. In the waiting area, the cushions of a sofas and chairs have been gnawed at and pulled apart. Dusty coffee mugs and filled ashtrays lie on the table. The water has turned brackish in a near by cooler. Sudden FLAPPING. We look up and see BIRDS nesting in the rafters. It is an eerie, haunted place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric! Are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric! All listen for a response. Nothing. Paul and Amanda exchange a despondent look. Sitting on the reception counter is an official-looking telephone. Everyone has the same thought, but no one dares. Finally -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell. Amanda puts the receiver to her ear. Nada. With Grant in the lead, they head deeper into the building. Unseen by the group, a fleeting SHADOW flits across the lobby's dirty windows with terrifying speed. 56
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A couple vending machines stand at the one end of this long hallway covered with vines. Paul notices them and pulls change from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see. I've got about a dollar seventy- five. How about you guys? Billy SMASHES IN the window of one machine with his boot. Picking through the glass, he pulls out some candy bars and chips. He checks the expiration date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank God for preservatives. He tosses the food to the others. Paul now turns to his own vending machine and SMASHES it with his heal. The glass refuses to break. 57
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant and Billy push through a set of doors to see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: filled with much of the same equipment we recognized from the first island, although the sheer size of this place dwarfs any of the facilities seen previously. As the group walks down the ramp and onto the floor, they begin to absorb the incredible array of technology: enormous cryonic freezer, their plug pulled years ago; empty incubators; tanks of formaldehyde with dinosaur fetuses and body parts. Machines with intricate tubing and wing arms stand beside conveyer belts cris crossing the room at different levels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is how you make dinosaurs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is how you play God. Billy looks around the lab. He can't help but be impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay if I take pictures? Grant nods. Billy sets his lucky camera back down on the worktable. Two years from now, astute observers of the DVD will not that Billy doesn't actually take his camera from the bag; he was carrying it because there wasn't any room inside. Billy pulls a new roll of film from the bag and zips it shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amanda is passing a large cylindrical tanks with half-formed embryos floating in formaldehyde -- genetic experiments gone awry. Finally she reaches
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: floating in the one tank. Something about this specimen catches Amandas attention. She bends forward, getting very close to the glass. She peers right into the eyes of the nightmarish creature. Then -- AN ACTUAL RAPTOR lunges at her form behind the tank. She SCREAMS. Fortunately the raptor can't get between the closely spaced tanks. Amanda runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amanda!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back out! Move! And as the group races through the lab the Raptors find a larger gap between the tanks. 58
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul leads the way, checking the door for possible escape routes or hiding places. Twenty feet behind,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rounds a corner, bolting after them. Paul ducks in the closest door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In here! 59
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group slams the door behind them and quickly takes in the room. There are several rows of oversized steel cages, apparently used for containing young dinosaurs. Many of the cage doors are standing open. The group races down a lone aisle. Close behind, the raptor
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the room, ROARS. As the Raptor gains ground, Udesky and Billy run into one of the open cages, SLAMMING the door behind them. Grant, Paul and Amanda duck into another. Before they can swing the cage door shut behind them, however, the raptor SLAMS into it, driving the door into the cage. They are forced back against a chain-like wall, trapped in a small triangle space by the advancing door. The angry Raptor is now inches away through the cage door. Then, suddenly, the raptor looks up. We follow its gaze. The top of their triangular enclose is wide open. The eager raptor climbs up the chain-like door. Catching the tail of an idea, Amanda grabs the door and nods to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Push! They push hard on the cage door, swinging it and the raptor right through the opening of the cage. Now the raptor is trapped in a small triangular space, the door going right to the ceiling. Amanda slides the door's bolt through the chain like wall, temporarily trapping the dinosaur. The raptor struggles desperately, GRAWLING AND SNARLING, but the cage door seems to be holding. As everyone rushes back to the door. The raptor begins to make a LOW, HAUNTING MOAN. As the others head for the door, Grant lingers a step, listening to the beast's simple melodic cry. It has the same tones as came from the model resonating chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's calling for help. 60
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group exits the rear of the lab building and finds itself in a large equipment yard. The CALL of the raptor is still audible as they head for the tree line. Now they moan is ANSWERED from distant jungle quarters. The responses quickly MULTIPLY. To the group's dismay, they soon find themselves virtually SURROUNDED by raptor CRIES both distant and near. Grant looks around with amazement. It's vindication of his theory on raptor communication, but it couldn't come at a worse time. Responding to the growls, a herd of grazing HADROSAURS suddenly flees across the open space. Then, in the distance behind the herd
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emerges from the jungles, coming their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Head for the trees! From the lab building, the raptor we left imprisoned now BURSTS out one of the doors and HOWLS to the pack -- the same cry we heard in the lab. The raptor pack moves into the hunting formation. One ALPHA-MALE RAPTOR. slightly larger than the others, leads the charge up the middle. Grant risks a looks back. But doesn't stop running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! In an effort to escape the oncoming raptors, Grant leads the group right into the stampeding heard of hadrosaurs. Suddenly, all is chaos. Hadrosaurs race past, splitting up the group. Letting the others get ahead of him, Grant looks back. Much to his dismay, the raptors are ignoring the hadrosaurs. Indeed, the pack weaves its way through the herd -- the raptors only want them. In the chaos of the stampede, everyone loses sight of each other. Up ahead, Billy trips and falls. As he rolls the strap on his camera bag breaks. He doesn't notice it's missing until he's already back on his feet and running. Amanda and Paul keep close to each other. Further back, Grant spots Billy's fallen camera back. He grabs it as he runs past. Looking back, Billy sees that Grant now has his back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! They lose sight of each other in the rush. 61-19
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EDGE OF THE JUNGLE - DAY                                        69A As the hadrosaurs WHIP PAST, Paul and Amanda climb up into a tree. A raptor leaps at Paul, barely missing his leg. Trying to pull Paul up, Amanda nearly loses her balance. This time, Paul catchers her. Billy climbs up a nearby tree of his own in sight of Paul and Amanda. Udesky has nearly reached a tree of his own when he finds himself
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: by a raptor. He turns to the other way, but finds
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He picks up a fallen branch as these dinosaurs cautiously approach. Not more than a few feet away, the leader of the trio stops, peering at him. Udesky swings hard, but the dinosaurs feints. From behind him, another raptor slashes at the back of his legs, severing his muscles. Udesky CRIES OUT and drops to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul, Amanda and Billy can hear him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Udesky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's this way. From here, the thick branches overlap, forming a kind of "second floor" above the ground. It's not easy, but you can move from branch to branch, tree to tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unable to walk, Udesky attempts to crawl away from the animals. The effort clearly causes him great pain. Strangely, the raptors suddenly don't seem interested in him anymore. Rather, they're "talking" among themselves. Udesky is amazed to find him self still alive. Suddenly, one of the raptors SLASHES at him again. But it's delicately not a mortal blow, just a very painful one. Udesky
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: louder this time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hearing the new cry, Paul, Amanda and Billy move faster, now finally seeing Udesky on the ground. He's face-down, barely moving but still MOANING. The raptors are gone. In the lead, Amanda starts to climb down. But Paul grabs her, holds her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to help him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right. A predator wouldn't leave a kill wounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not a kill, he's still alive. She breaks from Paul's grip and drops to the ground. She's only a foot away from the tree when
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lead out from their hiding places. They almost catch her as Billy and Paul pull her back up on the limb The raptors stare up at them, angry their plan didn't work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They couldnt climb up, so they were trying to get us to come down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They set a trap (amazed) They actually set a trap. Bored with waiting, the raptors go back to finish off Udesky, making a meal out of it. Up in the branches, the survivors are horrified and sickened. Then, from the deep in the forest, a new RAPTOR CRY. The feasting raptors look up, listening, then suddenly run off into the dark jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Grant? 69B
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbing higher in a tree, Grant is just feet above a growing pack of raptors. He scales one branch, the next, finally reaching a perch that the dinosaurs can't jump to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The entire pack is now standing still, watching him. In the center, the Alpha Male lets out a sort of BARK. Responding to the cry, the other raptors CALL BACK. As terrified as he is, he can't help but be fascinated by their communication. Like a hellish bird song, there's a rhythm to it, a structure. They're clearly talking about something. Under his breath, Grant is able to mimic its patterns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean? What are you saying? Of course they can't answer. They just keep using the same "phrase." Ready to ditch Billy's camera bag in order to climb higher -- he's had to hold it by the strap -- Grant finds his hand covered with a runny slime. He looks down at the camera bag, and that's the source. It's oozing out the bottom. He unzips the bag to find
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: inside, the white and green yolk still dripping from the pieces of the shell. There's another intact egg beside it. This is what the raptors where chasing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God damn you, Billy. Ever the scientist, Dr. Grant tests a theory even in the face of danger: he holds up the intact egg so that the raptors can see it. They suddenly go crazy, howling the same phrase but LOUDER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means, "Give us the egg," doesn't it? "We want the egg." He gently drops the bag to the ground. Although the raptors are interested, pulling out the unbroken egg, they're still by no means placated. The song may have changed, but they still want Grant dead. They begin to jump at him, eventually, hopping up on each others backs. It's only a matter of time till they reach him. Grant moves to climb higher, but sees no branches he can reach. And than he hears the low CREAKING. A CRACK. The branch he's on is starting to give in. He looks down at the face of his enemies, knowing he'll be their next meal. And then,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lands at the base of the trees, immediately SPRAYING out a thick cloud of oily fog. It's the first of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that land in the area, creating a thick cloud. It's not just smoke though something far more caustic. As it hits the raptors they immediately recoil, those closest to the canisters SHRIEKING in pain. Tumbling in the dirt. There may be a pheremonal element to the mist as well -- they seem panicked, disoriented. Pack mentality takes over, and after the first ten raptors take off running, so do the rest, some tripping over their feet blindly. This may be dino-tear gas, but it's not good for humans either. Up in the tree, Grant's eyes immediately burn from the vapor He squints to see through the fog, where he spots
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the edge of the smoke
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! They'll be back! Grant half-climbs, half-falls out of the tree, rushing to get through the heaviest of the smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grabs his, pulling him along. 69C
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes swollen from the gas. Grant stumbles, barely able to see as the other person pulls him along. It's only now we can identify his rescuer as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the boy he was brought to rescue. A lot has changed in the last eight weeks. It's not just dirt and muck -- he's the filthiest child you've ever seen -- something primal has come out in him. Something wild. 69D
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the far side of the tipped over vehicle, Eric pulls open a hatch -- his hiding place. The door opens part way. Eric motions for Grant to follow. 69E
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Squeezing in sideways -- it's very tight fit -- Grant finds himself in a space no bigger than the inside of a Datsun. lit by a small battery-powered lantern. This is where Eric has been hiding. The minute Grant's inside, Eric goes back to work re-sealing the door. This 13-year old boy has become astonishingly efficient at staying alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric... The boy holds up a hand. He listens for a moment. He doesn't hear anything outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric, your parents are both here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Costa Rica?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the island. Eric truly can't believe it. He hoped to be rescued but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll never make it. I mean, they can't manage when the cable goes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd be surprised what people can do when they have too. Eric studies his guest, finally certain he recognizes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Alan Grant, aren't you? (off surprised reaction) I read both of your books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one do you prefer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first one. Before you where on the island. You liked dinosaurs back then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back then, they hadn't tried to eat me. Grant takes a better look around Eric's tiny hideaway, impressed with what he's been able to scavenge. Among the many items we see another smoke canister, some battery-powered lanterns and lots of candy wrappers. This kid's been living on chocolate for weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When InGen cleared out, they left a lot of stuff behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any weapons, radios? Eric pulls up a long cattle prod to show Grant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Found this, but the battery's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a wonder you aren't. I'm amazed, Eric. I barely lasted 30 hours. You lasted eight weeks. The line catches Eric strangely. It's the first moment of true emotion we've seen him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all it's been? I thought it was longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The important thing is we both made it. That's something we have in common. Eric rips into a candy bar. After a moment, he realizes he should offer one to his guest as well. Grant takes it. A lone beat. Than, Grant just has to know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you read Malcolm's book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. I mean, it was kind of preachy. Chaos-this, chaos-that. And like, to me, the guy seemed kind of high on himself. Grant smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's two things we have in common. 69F
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trio is where we left them, perched up in the branches. They're far from safe, but nothing's after them for a while. In Billy's eyes, we can see a storm of guilt raging. But he hasn't said anything. Won't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't just stop looking. Eric and Dr. Grant are out there somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to find them too, but we can't do a bit of good right now. For every scary thing we saw in the daylight, I'll bet there ten times more of 'em at night. (to Billy) Am I right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dont know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you were an expert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Grant was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well Dr. Grant isn't here, so we're going to have to figure out what to do ourselves. Amanda is impressed by her own determinations. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do we do? No one has the faintest clue. 69G
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; The creatures of Isla Sorna walk past in the shadows, some looking up at the light in the trees. Suddenly, one of the creatures is attacked by another. We hear
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: just seeing the outline of the fight. Just as fast as it began, the fight is over, the winner snakes on the loser. 69H
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone's moved to different branches, trying to settle in for the night. Paul keeps looking over to the tearful Amanda, about to say something. He finally does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want you know, Amanda. It's not your fault what happened. Amanda looks over, not sure what his absolution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric has always been headstrong, and you throw Ben Hildebrand into the mix and well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well damn it. I don't speak ill of the dead. What I'm trying to say is, its was just a crazy accident. The exact same thing could have happened if he was with me. You can't go beating yourself up about it. Realizing he's trying his best, Amanda cant stay angry with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This wouldn't happen if he was with you. I mean, you drive five miles below the speed limit. I totaled three cars in fives years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That one time was just the bumper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He would have been, safe. Completely, entirely, suffocatingly safe. (beat) I would have him to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. I wanted to see more of the world than Enid, Oklahoma. And so yes, it's my fault that this happened. I'm sorry that you have to be here. Really looking at her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sorry at all. 69I
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning on Isla Sorna. A low mist hangs tight to the forest floor as Eric seals up his hideaway for hopefully the last time. They start walking. Eric pulls something out of his pocket, shows it off to Grant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know what this is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A raptor claw. I use to have one. A fossil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mine's new. Grant hands it back. Eric is becoming more and more a normal thirteen-year old boy. There's an innocence to him that's coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much of this island have you explored?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stayed pretty close to the compound, Figured if anyone came to look for me, that's where they'd start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to head for the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Closer you get to the water, the bigger things get. 69J
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy and Amanda wait for Paul as he comes out of the bushes, hiking up his shorts. Trying to take charge...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to stick to the plan. Head for the coast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Eric and Dr. Grant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going to the coast was Alan's idea. If he's alive, thats where he's headed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Eric? Billy represses his instinct to say Eric's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's probably has a better chance by the coast as it is. Figures that all the big dinosaurs would live in the center of the island. (to Billy) Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. 69K
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Grant and Eric walk, both stop, hearing a strange sound. But for a change, it's not an ominous one. It's a human one. A phone is RINGING, very faintly. Without a word to each other, Grant and Eric decide its coming from the right. 69L
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul is picking the briars out of his socks as they hike, risking tripping on every step. Then Amanda stops short. She's the first to hear it:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . After a beat, everyone else can hear it too. And recongnition finally lights on Paul's face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My phone. Suddenly, Paul frantically searches his pockets as the others anxiously watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had the phone the whole time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I don't have it with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you have it last?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't remember
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think. And Paul wracks his memory...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane. I got a call on the plane, put it in my coat pocket, and... Bust suddenly, he stops, his face is lighting with an awful realization. Amanda couldnt bear the wait...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?...WHAT!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I loaned it to Nash. He must have had it on him when he... The hideous implication of his words slowly sink in. 69M
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still following the faint RINGING, Grant and Eric turn to find
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moving through the low trees. We recognize it as the back of a spinosaurus. We might think it's any random spinosaurus, except for the RINGING coming from somewhere inside it. Grant and Eric press back against a tree, keep perfectly still as they hear the THOOOOMB, THOOOOMB, THOOOMB of the creature's footsteps reverberating. It's tail RUSTKES against the brush. It's moving behind them, and it's close. We hear the RINGING move from left to right as it passes. So far, its has no idea they're there. Looking across the clearing, Eric is startled to see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are no more than 20 yards away, also hiding. An involuntary reflex, Eric calls out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mon! Dad! Grant immediately covers the boys mouth. But it's to late. The dinosaur has stopped. We still can't see it. We don't know how close it is. Paul and Amanda spot Eric with Grant. They're a thousand emotions at once: relieved, disbelieving, terrified, overjoyed. They want to run to him, to yell out to him, but the monster is close. Grant takes his hand off Eric's mouth. They both stay completely silent. All this time, the sat-phone is RINGING. Than it stops. And after an agonizing beat, the beast moves. At first we're not sure which direction it's headed, but finally we can tell its moving away. Once the sail is finally out of sight, Eric breaks from Grant's hold and dashes to his parents' arms. They coop him up. Hug him, kiss him, their affection unquenchable. He's crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweetheart, you're okay. (reassuring herself) You're okay. (disbelieving) You're okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never had a doubt. Never did. Us Kirby men, we stick around, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do. Looking at her grubby son, Amanda licks her shirttail, trying to rub his face clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, there's not enough spit in the world for that. She LAUGHS. It's the first times she's laughed in two months. Billy crosses the distance to Grant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to keep moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan, I want to tell you that I'm so sorry about the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy, I can't talk to you now. He walks off. Billy follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, okay? Just yell at me. Call me an idiot. An asshole. Stupid. Tell me I screwed up because I know I did. Grant doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought if we could get a raptor back to the mainland, we could get serious money for it. Enough to fund the digging for 10 years. More. Whatever it took. Grant shakes his head, disgusted, But doesn't stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to believe me. I did it with the best intentions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the worst things imaginable have been done with the best intentions. You rushed in with no thought to the consequences, to yourself or anyone else. (finally) You're no better than the people who built this place. Grant keeps walking, leaving Billy with his guilt. 70
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group enters a structure with giant windows designed to look into the canyon beyond -- only there's nothing to see but a thick fog. Toward the center of the room, a spiral staircase that leads to a lower level. With Billy lagging, Grant approaches the stairs and peers down the circular opening in the floor. There is not much to see, just fog, a glint of sunlight. 71
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step by step, Grant leads the group down a rusty spiral staircase below the observation room. The stairs end in a lower level. Although we're technically outside, this whole place feel strangely enclosed. There's a thick fog at this level -- clouds, really -- but far below we can see the river. And at its banks, a barge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We climb down to the barge and follow the river out to the ocean. With any luck, the Costa Rican coast guard will pick us up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we go home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we go home. Grant leads everyone down a RAMP to -- 72        EXT. LANDING - DAY                                                        72 A catwalk branches off, a SET OF STAIRS continuing down the along the canyon wall. Grant starts down the stairs. He's only taken a few steps down the rusty staircase suddenly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Paul grabs him in the nick of time. The staircase vanish into the fog. CLANFING AGAINST the canyon wall. After a few more seconds of silence, they hear the CRASH far below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? Grant nods and looks in the other direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about if we try this way? Their only other option is a precarious catwalk that disappears into the mist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think it goes all the way across?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One way to find out. The only way to get his-near-fall is to push ahead. But his stomach turns at being so high. Amanda follows. The catwalk creaks and groans, listing slightly. She freezes mid-stride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd better do this one at a time. Amanda steps of and Grant carefully pushes forward, disappearing into the thick fog. The others listen to the CREAKING of the catwalk until it STOPS ABRIPTLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Grant? More silence. Then, out of the fog, a distant voice call out -- GRANT (O.S.) Come on over. One at a time. Amanda steps tentatively forwards. Eric is clinging to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric, its okay. You'll be right behind me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going anywhere, I promise. As Paul holds Eric, and Amanda shares a look. Amanda We're all together now, Eric. Eric reluctantly releases her mother. Amanda starts to cross. 73
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant has stopped at a lateral support across the catwalk, trying to get the sense of where they are and what purpose this place may have served. Seeing that the support beams are brace high arched walls of steal mesh, it becomes obvious that we are inside this vast construction. Amanda emerges from the mist and turns back to the catwalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay! Come on, Eric! 74
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric is next to go across. He's still tentative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout if I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I can do it. Billy and Paul look on as Eric disappears into the vapor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it Eric. Nice and easy... 75
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric slowly gropes his way forward. He feels a GUST OF WIND and a HEAVY THUD ahead on the catwalk which now sways beneath him. Regaining his balance, Eric peers forward, but the fog prevents him from seeing more than fifteen feet ahead. There is an EERIE SILENCE. Eric calls out timidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom? 75A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Across the canyon, Grant moves across the later support. With his hand on the railing, he sends a white, hardened substance dropping into the mist. Looking up, Grant notices a large strut, covered with the same substance. Realizing what it could be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bird cage. Then, the sound of Eric SCREAMING. 75B
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric watches as A LOOMING SHAPE emerges from the fog -- a nightmarish vision stalking purposefully forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing over seven feet high, walks upright on clawed feet, his thirty foot wings folded bat-like at his side. The creature sees Eric and fixes him with a demonic glare. Eric CRIES OUT and dashes back down the teetering catwalk. The Pteranodon ruses to its feet, spreads its thirty-foot wings and flies directly at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hearing Eric's SCREAMS, Paul charges onto the catwalk, searching in the fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't hold! Suddenly,
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AT THE OTHER END OF THE CATWALK

direction.raw_text: emerges from the fog, racing toward his father. And then
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swoops out of the fog, opens its giant rear claws, and snatches the terrified boy from the catwalk. Paul Kirby watches in stunned, abject horror as the Pteranodon carries Eric directly overhead -- PAUL ERIC! The flying reptile struggles with the boy's weight. Paul watches helplessly as Eric is carried high across the canyon. Paul runs back alone the catwalk in a desperate attempt to keep Eric in sight. Billy stays behind, moving back up the platform to try to keep the dinosaur in view. With a new idea, he races back up the stairs to the observation room. He has a way to save Eric. When he reaches the canyon wall, Paul turns a corner and runs along another enclosed catwalk leading deeper into the canyon. Grant and Amanda now come pounding down the catwalk trying to catch up with Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul! Where is he? Can you see him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying! That thing took him down this way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Split up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: carries Eric deeper into the canyon. The creature's wings beat steadily overhead, and the WIND is fierce. Eric looks down and sees the river far below. The Pteranodon swoops over an isolated outcropping of rocks at the end of the canyon and drops Eric into -- 75C        EXT. PTERANODON NEST - DAY                                        75C A large bowl of mud and branches the size of a satellite dish. Eric lands right on top of a pile of dinosaur bones picked clean. Mixed among is one human skull. Before Eric has time to cry out, he looks up to find
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: closing in on him with sharp-edged beaks. He picks up the human skull and whips it to the hatchlings. They easily duck it and keep coming. 76
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant looks up to see Billy leaning out over the edge of the observation platform. He suddenly realizes what Billy is about to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! WAIT! Billy SHOUTS BACK, an excited-terrified grin on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Billy jumps off the railing and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Grant, Paul and Amanda watch as Billy FALLS past them like a stone, plummeting towards certain death. But then -- THE PARASAIL CHUTE blossoms above him. Not only does it slows Billy's descent, but he even manages to catch an updraft and begin to rise. He struggles to control the parasail, swooping dangerously close to the canyon wall, barely avoiding it. Up ahead he catches sight of Eric and steers towards him. 77-80
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PTERANODON NEST - DAY                                        81 Eric struggles to keep away from the hatchlings. But there's no way out of this nest. Billy SWOOPS overhead, but he's too high to reach Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! HOLD ON! He circles around to make another attempt. 82
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul rounds the corner and finally catches sight of Eric in the nest, some fifty feet below, fighting off the hatchlings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on, Eric! Paul sees an outcropping he could jump onto from here. It's a big leap, though, he might not make it. He steels himself up for the jump, then chickens out. Grant and Amanda come up behind him. Suddenly,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the catwalk enclosure about them -- right next to a gaping hole in the mesh. The catwalk GROANS with the extra weight. The pteranodon JAMS its head through the hole, SNAPPING at them. 83
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy circles, making his approach. In the nest, Eric kicks at the hatchlings, but they're undeterred. Billy and Eric will only have one chance. As Billy swoops past, Eric jumps and grabs onto his boot. He is yanked up and out of the nest. But than, MOTHER PTERANODON shoots past, tearing out a piece of the parasail in its beak. 84-85
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OVER THE RIVER - DAY                                        86 The pteranodon who landed on the top of the catwalk continues to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through the hole in the enclosure. Finally the reptile's massive weight proves to much, and the entire section of the catwalk BREAKS FREE of the canyon wall and FLIPS OVER LATERALLY. Amanda, Grant and Paul are able to hang on, but so is the pteranodon, who now climbs their way. 87
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OVER THE RIVER - DAY                                        88 His parasail badly damaged, Billy tries to keep aloft. Heading as low as he dares, he yells to Eric -- BILLY Let go! Terrified, Eric falls into the river safely. He surfaces, immediately swimming to shore. Trying to gain altitude, Billy bends hard to the right. But the rigging is too badly damaged. He flies right into the canyon wall, hitting hard. Instead of tumbling down to the river, he finds himself swinging from his harness - the parasail snagged on a rock spire above him. 89
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul, Grant and Amanda struggle to stay away from the pteranodon as it moves towards them. Suddenly. the far end of this inverted section of catwalk detaches from the canyon wall and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The force of the action sends the three tumbling directly towards the pteranodon. Miraculously, they manage to avoid its open beak. But they are all sent plummeting toward the river below. 90
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hit the water hard, resurfacing moments later. The current is carrying them downstream. 91
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two pteranodons who were pursuing Billy now land on nearby ledges and consider how best to dispatch their prey. Billy frantically tries to unhook his harness, but the tension is so tight from his own weight that he can't loosen the buckles. 92-93
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER BANK - DAY                                              94 Paul and Amanda emerge from the water by the canyon wall and find their son hiding behind a rock, searching the skies for Billy. Amanda takes Eric tightly in her arms, and Paul urges them to keep moving. Up ahead, the mesh of the aviary meets the river. Wading the shore, Grant now scans the canyon, searching for Billy. It doesn't take long to spot him. 95
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy continues to struggle with the harness but to no avail. The doomed young man is suspended high up on the canyon wall like a modern Prometheus, an entire FLOCK of pteranodons gathering around him preparing to peck away his liver. And everything else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has landed beside him and looks him straight in the eye. The gigantic creature lunges at him. Billy dodges away as best he can. The pteranodon's frustrated bite severs a crucial juncture on Billy's harness, and Billy is able to wriggle free. 96
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric, Amanda, Paul and Grant watch in amazement as Billy is the last to PLUNGE DOWN into the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He made it! Billy bobs to the surface and spots the group downstream. He waves and begins to swim towards them. Soon he nears the shore and gets to his feet, wading as he comes. Grant, Paul, Amanda and Eric hurry to meet him. Grant is overjoyed to see him alive. But his smile quickly fades as he sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: diving down from above in angry pursuit of their lost prey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy, look out! Billy glances behind him. He races forward, motioning fro his companions to turn around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get back! Get back! Just then Billy is knocked down by the lead pteranodon. It strikes from behind with a brutal, calculated beak to the head. Billy stumbles and falls to the ground. Grant rushes forward with Paul right after him. Amanda takes Eric to safety down river. Billy SCREAMS as the ENTIRE FLOCK of pteranodons now swarms around him, picking him apart with their beaks and claws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no use, Dr. Grant. No use. Grant can't take his eyes off Billy, whose BLOOD stains the water rushing by. And now several pteranodons are heading their way. Difficult as it is to leave Billy behind, Grant and Paul make a run for it. Just as the pteranodons are about to swoop in for the kill, Alan and Paul dive back into the river... 97
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and resurfaces on the far side of the mesh aviary wall, GASPING for air. Just behind them, the mammoth
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the mesh. It tears at the steel, actually ripping it in one place. At the dock up ahead, Amanda and Eric have found a rusty, waterlogged barge that's somehow still floating. Carrying a tarp-covered cage, the boat was meant for transporting dinos up and down the river. Amanda pushes them away from the dock as Alan and Paul climb on board. 98
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The current takes the craft downstream, letting us get our first good look at the incredible
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's a vast, domed mesh structure that spans the entire canyon. In all, a feat of remarkable engineering and unmistakable hubris. Catching their breath, our four survivors look at the cage they were caught in. 99
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yanking the starter rope one final time, Paul finally gets the engine to turn over, PUTTERING along. Amanda is beside him, bailing water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My own kid was right in front of me and I didn't do a damn thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You couldn't have made that jump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should have tried. It should have been me on that beach back there, not Billy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you have helped Eric? (he can't answer) He needs you, Paul. He needs us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He could have died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he didn't. And neither did you. And I'm glad about that. 99A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant is beside Eric, keeping watch, but also feeling the weight of Billy's death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Although I've studied them in the wild. Eric looks over, not sure what that means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a theory that there's two kinds of boys. Those who want to be astronomers and those who want to be astronauts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to be an astronaut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I was the opposite. I never understood why anyone would want to go into space. It's so dangerous. You do one thing wrong and you're dead. The astronomer -- or the paleontologist -- get to study these amazing things from a place of complete safety. And truthfully, everything you really need to learn, you can learn it from the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But then you never get to go in space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. The difference between imagining how things might be and seeing how they really are. To be able to touch them. That's what Billy wanted to do. The barge starts to round a bend. On the bow, Grant and Eric are the fist to see something remarkable. Eric GASPS, unprepared. We don't know yet what they see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can blame the people who made this island. But I can't blame the people who want to see it. To study it. At the rear of the barge, Paul just now sees what's ahead. Awe- struck, he slows the motor and motions for Amanda to take a look. And so do we.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The setting sun illuminates an incredible valley filled with dinosaurs. We see armored ANKYLOSAURS with clubbed tails. Duck-billed CORYTHOSAURS. We float under the gigantic, arching necks of eighty-foot BRACHIOSAURS. With the mist from the river and the play of light, we're witnessing a kind of primal Eden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's a boy suppose to resist this? 100
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: passes behind clouds. THUNDER quietly rumbles, and
direction.name: direction
