direction.raw_text: flickers in the distance. Paul is still at the wheel. The river is narrower here, and cautions must be taken to avoid the banks. As the barge begins to round another bend. a FAMILIAR HIGH- PITCHED SOUND pierces the darkness. Muffled but unmistakable, it is the RINGING SAT-PHONE. All exchange looks of sheer PANIC, expecting Spinosaurus to leap out at any moment. Grant scans the river banks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep quiet. Paul cuts the motor, and time seems to stop as the four stand posed for action. The barge finishes rounding the curve, and the ringing grows
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The suspense is excruciating until finally... Their eyes widen at some horrifying sight, more horrifying than anything they've yet seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sit on the patch off treeless flat ground just beyond the river bank. As our friends consider the sight, an idea comes to them all of them almost simultaneously. With Eric still in the boat, Amanda, Paul, and Alan jump into the river and rush to the bank. 101
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three companions sprint towards the source of the RINGING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find it before it stops ringing! And bracing themselves and hocking their breath, they PLUNGE their arms into their respective dung-heaps. After a few moments of this disgusting search...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got something. I think I've got something! All turn to Paul. Clearing away the clinging defecation, he holds up to a beeper. And still the phone RINGS. Returning to their bleak task, they shovel the excrement with their arms. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got it! I've got it! Grant snatches the RINGING SAT-PHONE from Amanda's hands, presses a button, and puts it to his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too can own a time share in beautiful Guadalajara. Enjoy a meal in one of our four star restaurants, explore our coral reefs, or just walk on the beach... The Kirbys hear the recorded voice and let out a collective, heavy sigh. Grant shuts off the phone. In all the excitement, none of them notice a fierce horned
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: right behind them. The giant creature ROARS, ready to eat them. But as it gets in close, it smells them. Even a dinosaur won't eat something that is covered in shit. After a beat, the Carnotaur turns and walks away, back into the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't help but be a little offended. 102
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the cleaned satellite phone's display. The battery level indicator is FLASHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you do, don't call the U.S. Embassy. They won't do a God Damn thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we don't exactly have a Costa Rican phone book here, so it will have to be somebody we know in the states. Someone we can absolutely count on to send help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't trust Stan with a snowball in a blizzard. Paul glares at her. Now Eric notices something odd in the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? The others look down in the murky water. Just below the surface,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: passes beneath the boat. Then a SINGLE FISH jumps from the water. And another. And another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bonitas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something must've scared them. Another roll of THUNDER, this time much closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the motor going. Paul moves the motor and pulls the start cord. The engine sputters but won't come to life. And now the phone BEEPS. The battery is getting even weaker. Grant makes a quick decision and DIALS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you calling? But Grant ignores the question. RING. RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick up! Pick up! 103
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wearing his jammies, three-year old Charlie awkwardly picks up the phone with both hands. He has the mouthpiece next to his lips, but the earpiece is hanging out in space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hewwo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recognizing who it must be...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie? Charlie. Get your mother. Right away! A long silence. Charlie bites his lip, looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie? Are you there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hewwo? The sat-phone BEEPS again, this time much LOUDER. Amanda and Eric watch Grant, realizing their fate may hang on this single call. Paul struggles without success to start the motor. Then, unseen by the group, a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises from the water just fifty yards from the barge. It's headed right to them and closing fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie! It's the dinosaur man! Go get mommy, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Not sure what to do with the phone, Charlie makes a logical choice and hangs it back up. He walks away to his mom. 104
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [END INTERCUTTING]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant realizes he's been cut off. He's about to redial when
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The barge is RAMMED, sending everyone tumbling. Grant manages to stay on top of the wheelhouse, but he loses grip on the phone, which falls on deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises from the water, towering over the barge. As lightning
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and thunder CRACKS, the dinosaur lets out an ear- splitting ROAR. It lunges at Grant with gaping jaws. Grant leaps out of the way just in time as the dinosaur
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the entire wheelhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie leads Ellie into the room. Hands her the phone. Of course, it's just a DIAL TONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was somebody on the phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dinosaur man. Ellie looks at him with confusion, then quickly checks the Caller ID box besides the phone. It's international, and not a number she recognizes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant stays one step ahead of the Spinosaurus as the beast rips apart the quickly-sinking boat. It spits out the wheelhouse and bites down on the stern of the boat, ripping off a chunk. Grant is heading up to the other three when he hears the sat- phone RING.  He spots it, just about to fall into the water. Dives for it, answering...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan? She can hear the Spinosaurus ROAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alan? Alan! But he's cut off by a SECOND ROAR, the sound of someone
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And then the line goes dead. Ellie pales. Charlie looks at her with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raaaar! 106B
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dropping the dead phone, Grant scrambles towards the front of the boat and joins Paul, Amanda and Eric, who have taken refuge in the dinosaur cage. The fearsome beast now lifts the stern of the boat clear out of the water. The cage SCRAPES across the deck and SLAMS into the gunwale, toppling off the barge and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Grant and the Kirbys are still inside. 107
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cage sinks. The closest to the door, Paul manages to get out. The other three aren't as lucky. The cage rotates as it descends and lands on the river bottom with the door side down, trapping them inside. In the cold murky depths, they pull frantically on the bars. Debris and equipment float around them. Paul surfaces out of the breath and disoriented. Spinosaurus pushes past the boat. If anyone is going to save his family, it has to be him. And so he dives. Pushing with all his might, he manages to tip the heavy structure, just enough so Amanda, Eric and Grant can get out. Paul himself isn't so lucky. Spinosaurus grabs the cage and Paul, throwing both straight up out of the water. Paul flies twenty feet away, further from the shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Spinosaurus is going after the heroic Mr. Kirby, who dives, swimming underwater. He's trying to lead it away from his family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up! Up! He points to a heavy crane assembly, designed for lifting cages off the large boats. Now well accustomed to fleeing on command, Amanda sends Eric up first, climbing the scaffolding like a jungle gym. All the while, they're trying to spot Paul. Grant is the last to climb, reaching the first section as Spinosaurus returns from the water, SLAMMING into the base of the crane. The whole assembly SHUDDERS, threatening to rip into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just hold on. Try as it might, the beast can't climb the crane. So instead it
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it, SHAKES it, trying to knock them off. Eric slips, but Amanda catches him. About to shed his bag to climb higher, Grant finds one last hope. It's the resonation chamber model. A beat before he decides: It may not be the best choice, but it's the only choice. He blows through it, the same EERIE PITCH we heard before. On the third try, he's able to approximate the "egg" cry he heard the raptors give. He keeps it up, repeating over and over. Spinosaurus stops for a beat, confused How this sound could be coming from a non-raptor. But then keeps SMASHING. We can hear the mounting bolts STRAIN. Soon the whole crane will tip. But not before a MATCHING CRY is heard in the jungle. Grant stops, not certain he heard it. But there it is AGAIN. He keeps blowing. The crane is close to tipping when a single RAPTOR appears from the darkness, CHIRP-BARKING at the Spinosaur, who simply bats away. But then MORE RAPTORS come. And even MORE. Soon there are dozens gathering, circling. Grant stops signaling. All three survivors watch with horrified fascination, knowing their fate is perilous no matter which side wins. Looking at his adversaries, Spinosaurus ROARS. And suddenly the raptors attack. Spinosaurus easily handles the first few, but like ants they just keep coming. They climb up his back, slicing, into him with their razor-sharp claws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jump! Swim for the far shore! All three drop from the crane arm into the water. Meanwhile, the fight continues. Spinosaurus rallies, shaking off many of the raptors, but they just keep coming. Their hooked claws dig in, scraping the meat to the bone. Spinosaurus puts up a brave fight to the end, but finally collapses, dead. The raptors continue to shred it to ribbons. Then one of the raptors looks over to see the survivors swimming away. But a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush. It goes back to its meal. 107A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant is trying to move them along. still headed downstream. But Eric won't budge another foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to keep looking for Dad. We have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I know. I want to look for him too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then we should... She kneels down, facing him. She's just as upset as he is, but motherhood carries the burden of remaining calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me tell you a few things about you Dad, okay? He's very very very clever, very very brave, and he loves you ever very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loves you too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. He loves us very very much. And I know that right now more than anything, your Dad would want to know that we're safe. Okay? Eric nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to get out of this, and everything's going to be all right, I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to your mother. Out of the darkness steps Paul Kirby. Amanda is knocked over with surprise. Eric runs to him, nearly tackling him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good thing I've been swimming, huh? Amanda hugs him and Eric so tightly they can't breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEACH - DAY                                                        110 The foursome sit back on the wide beach, one facing each direction, keeping watch. A light rain is falling, but they don't seem to notice. Trying to keep his boy's spirit up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember when we went fishing last summer? And I was trying to put the boat in and the trailer sank? And then the tow truck came and tried to pull it out, but it got dragged in? And the truck driver threatened to knock your Dad's lights out? So I said I was the governor and he believed me? Eric really smiles, remembering the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Amanda is smiling too. She had completely forgotten the incident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a fun day. To Paul, after some consideration....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should try fishing again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. It's worth another shot. And who knows? Things might turn out differently. Her hand takes his, gently brushing off the wet sand, fingertips touching. It's a small thing, but it's a start. Sensing his cue to leave, Grant gets up and starts walking down the beach. Eric hurries to follow him. He speaks conspiratorially, not wanting to alarm his parents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lady you called, how do you know she can help us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's the one person I could always count on. And she's saved me more times than she realizes. I owe her everything. A long beat as they walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's strikes me now I never told her that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. As they keep walking, Grant notices something rammed against the rocks ahead. It's a speedboat, its hull ripped open from the impact. And it's not just any boat either -- it's the same Dino-Soar boat that was pulling the parasail. Eric hasnt seen it yet, so Grant stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric, do you know what happened to the boat? that brought you here? Why did it crash?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I couldn't see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do me a favor. Go back to your parents for a minute, would you? (pre-empting objections) They look worried. Eric nods and heads back to Paul and Amanda. Grant forges on, approaching the speedboat wreckage. He doesn't know what he'll find, but he needs to look. Almost reaching his parents, Eric stops. Looks out over the ocean, where he sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He doesn't say anything for a moment, trying to make sure they're real. They are. And they're coming closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom! Dad! They look up to see the distant lights, just now making out full forms...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helicopters. Helicopters! He SHOUTS with joy. Paul, Amanda and Eric wave their arms, making as much motion as possible. The helicopters -- big military choppers -- change direction, heading straight for them. Paul and Amanda embrace, then kiss, the moment getting the best of them
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant looks in, prepared to see anything in the wreckage. But the cabin is surprisingly intact, just a little blood. There are three gashes on the driver's seat back. Grant measures their spacing with his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Grant! Helicopters are coming! Grant looks down to the wet sand around him, finding a trail of three-toed tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're safe!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No we're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . flies right overhead. Paul and Amanda are confused, until the second helicopter starts to land -- the first on is there to cover them. Grant YELLS at the first chopper, trying to wave it away. But the noise of the blades is DEAFENDING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NO! STAY BACK! THEY'RE IN THE TREES! At the treeline, the upper branches are shaking. At first, it looks like it's just the wind off the chopper, but something more is happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flies up out of the trees, the first of twenty. It's a gorgeous and terrifying sight. 110A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrified, the Costa Rican CHOPPER PILOT veers away, but the pteranodons are already on him. They SMASH at the windows, grabbing on the skids, The chopper rolls wildly. One over-eager pteranodon sticks his head up to high, getting decapitated by the blade. 110B
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the second chopper touches down on the beach, Eric, Amanda and Paul load in. Grant is running their way. 110C
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meanwhile, the first copper is losing the battle even as it climbs higher. The helicopter suddenly tips, falling, SMASHING into the trees with a massive fireball. 110D
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seeing the explosion, the SECOND CHOPPER PILOT takes off. Eric, Amanda and Paul are on board, but Grant is still running up. The helicopter passes right over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to go back! We can't leave him! Seeing a ladder release by the door, Paul throws the lever. A cord- and-steel-ladder unfurls, dragging across the sand. 110E
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grant chases after us, catching a rung just as it goes over the water. Behind him, pteranodons are circling the wreckage of the first chopper and starting to go after the second. Buffeted by the wind, Grant climbs the ladder up towards the chopper. A pteranodon flies up right behind him, trying to bite. It catches Grant's shoulder. Grant spins to the far side of the ladder. The pteranodon goes to bite him again, but finds it head caught between the rungs. As it tries to free itself, it just gets more entangled. The entire ladder starts to lift, caught by the updraft from the creatures wings. 110F
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up with the pilot, Amanda sees the other pteranodons are headed back to the island, unable to keep up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not following. In back, Paul and Eric get the ladder mechanism to begin to retract. It reels Grant in faster. It also reels in the pteranodon, which may be caught, but is still plenty dangerous. As Grant reaches the cabin, they shut off the ladder engine. The pteranodon is still working its way free, pulling itself closer and closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to cut it! Find something sharp! Everyone checking the cabin for a knife, anything sharp. Finally, Eric hands Grant the raptor claw. Grant uses it to rip the line. The fibers break and fray, but the pteranodon keeps coming closer. Paul throws a wrench at the pteranodon, WHACKING it straight in the head. It felt good, and damn if it didn't slow it down a little. Grant has cut through the cord. He started on the second when the pteranodon SNAPS at him, going for his hand. There's nowhere for Grant to cut without the pteranodon getting him. And idea, Grant very deliberately places in his hand on the line, pulling away at the last moment. The pteranodon itself bites through the line. 110G
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pteranodon falls away from the helicopter, catching wind just before it hits the water. It circles and flies back to Isla Sorna. As horrifying as the creature was a moment ago, it's suddenly beautiful again. Each motion of its giant wings is a small symphony. 110H
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sitting between his parents, Eric looks back at the island in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think is going to happen with the dinosaurs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The population will Stabilize eventually. They'll adapt to fit different roles.
direction.name: direction
